title.narrative: NUTRITION INTERVENTIONS TO REDUCE STUNTING AND ANAEMIA

description.narrative: Output 1.2: By 2023, Government and partners have improved capacity to deliver nutrition interventions to reduce stunting and anaemia among children under the age of five years and reduce anaemia among adolescents., which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 101: By 2023, newborns, children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from quality, inclusive and gender-responsive health, nutrition and improved Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2: By 2023, Government and partners have improved capacity to deliver nutrition interventions to reduce stunting andanaemia among children under the age of five years and reduce anaemia among adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s support contributed to the nationwide scale up of Multiple Micronutrient Powder (MNP) Supplementation with counselling on Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) for children aged 6-23 months in 2021 with coverage of >90 percent to prevent anemia and stunting. The endorsement of the first multisectoral National Nutrition Strategy and Action Plan (2021-2025) has facilitated evidence-based nutrition specific and nutrition sensitive interventions across the life cycle. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2021

title.narrative: Implementation of programmes to improve diet diversity in children

target.value: 2023:3 – Four to five programmes are implemented by the government to improve the diversity of diets in children aged 6-23 months

actual.value: 2021:2 – Two to three programmes are implemented by the government to improve the diversity of diets in children aged 6-23 months
